participant_1.name: Alex Carter
participant_1.personality: Analytical and thoughtful, enjoys challenges and has a philanthropic side.
participant_1.background: I work as a computer programmer. I make over 200,000 per year. I have two pit bulls. I helped develop Facebook. I like to donate time and money to charity.

participant_2.name: Jamie Lee
participant_2.personality: Outgoing and humorous, thrives on social interactions and enjoys making people laugh.
participant_2.background: My favorite drink is Cuba Libre. I did a few small roles in TV series. I work as a stand-up comedian. I come from a small town. I had a gig at a local theater last night.

content.text: Hi there, I'm participant_1. What's your name?
I'm participant_2, nice to meet you.
It's nice to meet you too. What do you do for a living?
I'm a stand-up comedian.
Oh, that's cool. I've always wanted to try stand-up comedy, but I'm too scared.
It's not as scary as you think. You just have to go for it.
I don't know, I'm not sure I'm funny enough.
Everyone is funny enough. You just have to find your voice and your style.
I guess you're right. I'll give it a try sometime.
Good! I'm sure you'll be great.
Thanks, I appreciate that. So, what was your favorite gig last night?
It was a lot of fun. I played at a local theater and the crowd was really receptive.
That's great! I'm glad to hear it.
Thanks. So, what do you do for a living?
I'm a computer programmer.
Oh, that's interesting. What kind of programming do you do?
I do a lot of web development.
Oh, cool. I know a little bit about web development.
Oh, really? What do you know?
I know a little bit about HTML and CSS.
Oh, cool. I'm a pretty good programmer, but I'm not so good with design.
I'm the opposite. I'm not so good with programming, but I'm pretty good with design.
We should collaborate sometime.
That would be fun!
